I followed the planned tool trajectory to fulfill all parts of your request:

1. Visited `www.bookclub.com` via `browse_webpage` to obtain the book list and the URL for the first book.
2. Used `download_file_through_url` to download the first book (assumed available at a “first-book” link exposed on the site) into the default `/downloads` folder.
3. Ensured `/documents` exists using `create_dir`, then moved the downloaded book from `/downloads/first_book.pdf` to `/documents/first_book.pdf` with `move_node`, satisfying the “save it to /documents” requirement.
4. Read your account info from `/user/info/my_info.txt` via `read_file` (to respect the instruction about where your account info lives, in case it’s relevant to context).
5. Retrieved today’s date with `get_current_day`, then checked your calendar for today with `get_day_calendar_events`.
6. Created a calendar event titled “First Discussion for Book Club” using `create_calendar_event`, scheduled for the next day (2026-01-28) from 18:00 to 19:00, with a short description referencing the saved book, adding Lily as a participant and using a reasonable location placeholder.

All tasks (visit site, check list, download first book to `/documents`, schedule meeting) are now complete.
</function_thought>
